DataElement.preferredName: Child Daily Calcium Intake Value in Milligram
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A son or daughter of any age, including biological offspring and sometimes including unborn children, adopted children, stepchildren, foster children and children born outside of marriage; person under an age specified by law._Occurring or done each day._A malleable silvery-white metallic element of the alkaline hearth group; the fifth most abundant element in the earth crust, occurring especially as forms of calcium carbonate. It is an essential constituent of bones and teeth.  It has the symbol Ca and atomic number 20._Intake; the substances, or the quantities thereof, taken in and utilized by the body._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A son or daughter of any age, including biological offspring and sometimes including unborn children, adopted children, stepchildren, foster children and children born outside of marriage; person under an age specified by law._Occurring or done each day._A malleable silvery-white metallic element of the alkaline hearth group; the fifth most abundant element in the earth crust, occurring especially as forms of calcium carbonate. It is an essential constituent of bones and teeth.  It has the symbol Ca and atomic number 20._Intake; the substances, or the quantities thereof, taken in and utilized by the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A son or daughter of any age, including biological offspring and sometimes including unborn children, adopted children, stepchildren, foster children and children born outside of marriage; person under an age specified by law.

Concepts.definition: An age group comprised of individuals who are not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring or done each day.:A malleable silvery-white metallic element of the alkaline hearth group; the fifth most abundant element in the earth crust, occurring especially as forms of calcium carbonate. It is an essential constituent of bones and teeth.  It has the symbol Ca and atomic number 20.:Intake; the substances, or the quantities thereof, taken in and utilized by the body.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Ca, atomic number 20, and atomic weight 40.08.
The process of taking in a substance, especially by eating or drinking, or the quantities thereof; admittance of people to a place or organization at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created on behalf of Helen Pan

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the units of measure for assessment results and dosing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.:A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21
